channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Snapchat users are going to have to pay to keep their memories
item.description: First came the burning of the Library of Alexandria. Then came the news that Snapchat is constructing a paywall around Memories. The company announced...

item.title: Personalize Your Marketing for What Consumers Want to See
item.description: Some ideas are free, and others are low cost.

item.title: Sanders: AI may take 100 million jobs in the next 10 years
item.description: Bernie Sanders says in a new ChatGPT-assisted report released Monday that AI and automation could eliminate nearly 100 million jobs over the next deca...

item.title: MIT researchers studied 16 million election-related AI responses. They found chatbots are ‘sensitive to steering,’ raising questions about LLMs’ neutrality
item.description: The researchers found that, to varying degrees, the models’ responses tended to be swayed by users sharing demographic information.

item.title: Holiday shopping will look different this year, Adobe predicts: AI-assisted purchasing will jump a staggering 520%
item.description: Adobe anticipates this activity peaking around Thanksgiving, with categories such as toys, electronics, and jewelry seeing the biggest boost from AI s...

item.title: Top analyst ‘very concerned’ about Nvidia fueling an AI bubble and a ‘Cisco moment’ like the dotcom crash: ‘We’re a lot closer to the seventh inning than the first or second inning’
item.description: "The guy at the epicenter [is] basically starting to do what all ultimate bad actors do in the final inning," Morgan Stanley's Lisa Shalett tells Fort...

item.title: What’s Really Behind the Government Shutdown: The Same Reason Employer Health Costs Could Soar
item.description: Millions of Americans are in for an unsavory awakening in the coming weeks as next year’s open enrollment approaches.

item.title: Dizzying deal delirium: How the AI bubble bursts
item.description: At our Yale Chief Executive Leadership Institute CEO Summit in June, we heard similar admonitions from over 150 top CEOs. They've seen this before.

item.title: Many Leaders Say They’d Drop Their Titles to Be More Engaged at Work. Here’s Why
item.description: The corporate ladder executives climb may be showing a few structural cracks, as the pressures of the modern workplace get worse.

item.title: Deloitte was caught using AI in $290,000 report to help the Australian government crack down on welfare after a researcher flagged hallucinations
item.description: The updates “in no way impact” the report’s findings and recommendations, the Big Four firm said.

item.title: Dell raises long-term growth targets, citing AI server demand
item.description: Dell on Tuesday nearly doubled its annual profit growth target for the next four years, betting on robust demand for its servers that power artificial...

item.title: The New York Stock Exchange owner wants in on election betting—what that means for the industry
item.description: The New York Stock Exchange’s (NYSE) parent company Intercontinental Exchange (ICE) said on Tuesday it will invest up to $2 billion into the crypto-ba...

item.title: The 5-Minute Personal Brand Audit for Every Entrepreneur
item.description: A quick monthly audit adds up over time, improving reputation and business opportunities.

item.title: Did a Reddit moderator pirate Nintendo games? A $4.5 million lawsuit says he did
item.description: Nintendo has filed a lawsuit against an individual it says is a moderator on Reddit , accusing him of piracy and facilitating a network of websites th...

item.title: Your Office Is Full of “Bad Doors”
item.description: Burnout isn’t a talent problem, it’s a design flaw. Fix the system, not the people.
